help.title: User Guide
help.subtitle: Complete guide to CIVICycle - Recycling Management System
help.gettingStartedDesc: CIVICycle is a comprehensive recycling management system designed to help cooperatives and recycling businesses track materials from collection through sale. The system covers the entire workflow: registering waste pickers (vendors) and clients, recording material purchases with quality grading and source traceability, managing inventory across multiple locations, processing sales with delivery tracking, and generating detailed reports. Log in with your email and password to begin. Your role (Admin, Manager, Operator, or Viewer) determines which features you can access. The sidebar menu on the left provides navigation to all modules.

dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.desc: The Dashboard is your home screen and provides a real-time overview of your recycling operations. It displays four summary cards at the top: Total Purchases (last 30 days), Total Sales (last 30 days), Current Stock (all materials across all locations), and Pending Payments (outstanding amounts owed to vendors). Below the summary cards you will find Quick Actions buttons for common tasks, a Recent Transactions list showing the latest activity, and Low Stock Alerts highlighting materials that are running low at any location.
dashboard.howTo:
After logging in, you are automatically taken to the Dashboard.
Review the summary cards to get a quick overview of your business metrics.
Use the Quick Action buttons to quickly create a new transaction, view reports, or manage inventory.
Scroll down to see recent transactions and click on any transaction to view its details.
Check the Low Stock Alerts section to identify materials that need replenishment.
dashboard.tips:
The summary cards update in real-time as transactions and sales are recorded.
Low Stock Alerts are based on material quantities falling below the configured threshold.
Click 'View all transactions' to navigate to the full Transactions page with filters.
The Dashboard is accessible to all user roles.

transactions.title: Transactions (Purchases)
transactions.desc: The Transactions module handles all material purchases from waste pickers (vendors). Each transaction records which vendor sold the material, what type of material it is, the weight in kilograms, the quality grade (Premium, Standard, or Low), the unit price, payment method, and payment status. Transactions can optionally track the source origin - which apartment complex and specific unit the material came from. This enables full traceability. Prices automatically fill in from the daily pricing configuration. You can view, filter, search, void, and print transactions.
transactions.howTo:
Navigate to Transactions in the sidebar menu.
Click 'New Purchase' to create a new purchase transaction.
Select the drop-off location (recycling station) where the material was received.
Select the material type from the dropdown - the unit price will auto-fill from daily prices.
Select the waste picker (vendor) who brought the material.
Enter the weight in kilograms and select the quality grade.
Optionally select a Source Origin (apartment complex and unit) for traceability.
Choose the payment method (Cash, Bank Transfer, or Mobile Money) and payment status.
Enter any paid amount and optional notes.
Click 'Save Transaction' to record the purchase.
transactions.tips:
Prices auto-fill from the daily price settings - make sure prices are configured in Admin Panel > Pricing.
If you are offline, the transaction will be saved locally and synced when you reconnect.
Use the search bar to find transactions by source, material, location, or vendor name.
Filter by payment status to find unpaid transactions quickly.
You can mark transactions as Paid, edit notes, or void transactions from the transaction list.
Voiding a transaction creates a reversal entry with negative values - it does not delete the original record.
Use 'Print Table' to generate a printable view of your filtered transactions.
Use 'Expand All' or 'Collapse All' to manage the transaction list view.

inventory.title: Inventory
inventory.desc: The Inventory module shows current stock levels across all your recycling locations and material types. Stock quantities update automatically whenever a purchase transaction is recorded (stock increases) or a sale is made (stock decreases). The page displays summary cards for Total Stock, Stock Value (estimated using current sale prices), Material Types count, and Zero Stock Items. A bar chart shows stock distribution by material category. The main table lists every material at every location with current quantity, sale price per kg, estimated value, and stock status.
inventory.howTo:
Navigate to Inventory in the sidebar menu.
Review the summary cards at the top for a quick overview.
Use the 'Filter by Location' dropdown to view stock at a specific recycling station.
Scroll through the table to see all materials and their quantities.
Look for items marked 'Low Stock' (amber) or 'No Stock' (red) that need attention.
inventory.tips:
Inventory is automatically managed - you do not need to manually update stock levels.
The estimated value is calculated using the latest sale price for each material.
Low Stock items are highlighted in amber to draw your attention.
The bar chart provides a visual summary of your most stocked materials.
Inventory data is read-only - changes come from creating transactions or sales.

reports.title: Reports & Analytics
reports.desc: The Reports module provides comprehensive business intelligence with five report tabs: Overview (summary statistics, transaction trends chart, and key metrics), Purchases (detailed purchase reports grouped by vendor, material, or showing all individual transactions), Sales (sales reports grouped by client, material, or detailed view with delivery status), Traceability (material flow from source to buyer), and Analysis (aggregate data with flexible grouping by vendor, source, unit, material, location, or client). All reports support custom date ranges and can be exported as PDF, CSV, or Excel files. Reports can also be emailed directly to recipients.
reports.howTo:
Navigate to Reports in the sidebar menu.
Select the desired report tab: Overview, Purchases, Sales, Traceability, or Analysis.
Set the date range using the Start Date and End Date fields.
For Purchases, Sales, and Analysis tabs, choose a grouping option (by vendor, material, client, etc.).
Review the generated report data in the tables and charts.
Click 'Export Report' and choose PDF, CSV, or Excel format to download.
Click 'Email Report' to send the report to a recipient's email address.
reports.tips:
The Overview tab gives the best high-level summary of your business performance.
Use the date range to compare different periods (e.g., this month vs last month).
The Purchases report shows outstanding payments - useful for tracking vendor debts.
The Analysis tab is the most flexible - try different groupings to discover insights.
Email reports require SMTP to be configured in Admin Panel > Email Settings.
PDF exports include formatted headers and are best for sharing with stakeholders.
CSV and Excel exports include raw data suitable for further analysis in spreadsheets.

vendors.title: Vendors (Waste Pickers)
vendors.desc: The Vendors module manages waste pickers - the individuals who collect and sell recyclable materials to your cooperative. For each vendor, you can store: first name, last name, government ID number (encrypted at rest), phone number, email, address, preferred payment method (Cash, Bank Transfer, or Mobile Money), bank name and account number, and affiliation status. Vendors can be searched, edited, and deleted. The vendor list shows key information and status at a glance.
vendors.howTo:
Navigate to Vendors in the sidebar menu under the CRM section.
Click 'Add Waste Picker' to register a new vendor.
Fill in the required fields: First Name, Last Name, and at minimum one contact method.
Select the preferred payment method and enter bank details if applicable.
Toggle the 'Affiliated' switch if the vendor is affiliated with your cooperative.
Click Save to create the vendor record.
To edit a vendor, click the edit icon on their row in the list.
To delete a vendor, click the delete icon and confirm.
vendors.tips:
Government ID numbers are encrypted in the database using AES-256 for security.
Use the search bar to quickly find vendors by name, ID number, phone, or email.
Vendors must be created before they can be selected in purchase transactions.
The vendor's preferred payment method will be pre-selected when recording purchases.
Affiliated vendors can be distinguished from independent ones for reporting purposes.

clients.title: Clients
clients.desc: The Clients module manages the companies and individuals who purchase your processed recyclable materials. For each client, you can record: company name, contact person name, phone number, email, address, payment terms, and notes. Clients can be activated or deactivated. Only active clients appear in the sales form dropdown. The client list supports searching and filtering.
clients.howTo:
Navigate to Clients in the sidebar menu under the CRM section.
Click 'Add Client' to register a new buyer.
Fill in the company name and contact information.
Specify payment terms if applicable.
Click Save to create the client record.
To edit a client, click the edit icon on their row.
To deactivate a client, click the deactivate button and confirm.
clients.tips:
Clients must be created before they can be selected when creating sales.
Deactivated clients are hidden from the sales form but their historical data is preserved.
Use the search bar to find clients by name, contact person, or email.
Clients are accessible to Admin, Manager, and Operator roles.

sources.title: Sources (Apartment Complexes)
sources.desc: The Sources module tracks the origin of recyclable materials by managing apartment complexes, buildings, and their individual units. Each source has a name, address, contact information, and a list of units. Units represent individual apartments or offices within a complex, each with a unit number, floor, resident name, and resident phone. This module is essential for traceability - it connects material purchases to specific physical locations and residents.
sources.howTo:
Navigate to Sources in the sidebar menu under the CRM section.
Click 'Add Source' to create a new apartment complex or building.
Fill in the name, address, and contact details.
Click Save to create the source.
Click on a source name to open its detail page and manage units.
Click 'Add Unit' to add individual apartment units with resident information.
Use 'Bulk Add Units' to quickly add multiple units at once (e.g., units 101-110).
When creating a transaction, select the source and unit in the Source Origin section.
sources.tips:
Bulk Add is useful for setting up new apartment complexes - you can add ranges of unit numbers.
Each unit can optionally have resident name and phone for contact purposes.
The source detail page shows statistics: active units, total transactions, and total weight collected.
Deactivating a source hides it from the transaction form but preserves historical data.
Sources enable the Traceability module to track materials back to specific apartments.

sales.title: Sales
sales.desc: The Sales module records the sale of recyclable materials to your clients (buyers). Each sale captures: the client, material type, weight in kilograms, unit price (auto-filled from daily pricing), total amount, payment method, payment status, delivery status, and optional notes. Sales affect inventory - when a sale is created, the corresponding stock is deducted from the selected location. If stock is insufficient, a warning dialog appears letting you decide whether to proceed. Sales support payment tracking, delivery management, voiding, and note editing.
sales.howTo:
Navigate to Transactions in the sidebar and click the 'Sales' tab, or find Sales in the CRM section.
Click 'New Sale' to create a new sale.
Select the client who is purchasing the materials.
Select the location (recycling station) the material will be shipped from.
Select the material type - the unit price will auto-fill from daily pricing.
Enter the weight in kilograms.
Choose the payment method and set the payment status.
Add optional notes.
Click 'Create Sale' to record the sale.
If stock is insufficient, a warning will appear - you can choose to continue or cancel.
sales.tips:
The system checks available stock before creating a sale and warns you if inventory is insufficient.
Sale prices auto-fill from the daily pricing configuration in Admin Panel.
Use the payment status dropdown to track Pending, Paid, or Partial payments.
Delivery status can be updated separately (Pending, In Transit, Delivered).
Voiding a sale creates a reversal entry and restores the stock to inventory.
The sales list supports filtering by payment status and searching by client name or material.

delivery.title: Delivery Tracking
delivery.desc: Delivery tracking is integrated within the Sales module and allows you to manage the physical delivery of sold materials to clients. When marking a sale as delivered, you can record detailed delivery information including: vehicle type (Truck, Van, Pickup, etc.), vehicle registration/license plate number, driver full name, driver ID card number, and delivery notes. This information creates a complete chain of custody record for compliance and traceability purposes. Email confirmations can be automatically sent when deliveries are completed.
delivery.howTo:
Open a sale from the sales list by clicking on it.
Click 'Mark as Delivered' to open the delivery details form.
Select the delivery status: In Transit, Delivered, or Partial.
Fill in the vehicle information: vehicle type and registration number.
Fill in the driver information: full name and ID card number.
Add any delivery notes (optional).
Click Save to update the delivery status.
The delivery details are stored and can be viewed at any time from the sale record.
delivery.tips:
Delivery confirmations can be enabled in Admin Panel > Confirmations to auto-email clients.
The driver ID card and vehicle registration create a chain of custody record.
Delivery status options: Not Delivered, In Transit, Partial, Delivered.
All delivery details are included in the sales reports for audit purposes.
You can update delivery details multiple times as the delivery progresses.

traceability.title: Traceability
traceability.desc: The Traceability module provides end-to-end tracking of recyclable materials from their source (apartment complex and unit) through collection (by a specific waste picker) to final sale (to a client). It uses a powerful filter system with five criteria: Source Apartment Complex, Specific Unit, Waste Picker, Material Type, and Date Range. Results are displayed in two views: a Summary table grouped by source and material showing totals, and a detailed expandable list showing individual transactions with full details including transaction number, date, weight, grade, unit/resident, and cost.
traceability.howTo:
Navigate to Traceability in the sidebar menu under the CRM section.
Click 'Show Filters' if the filter panel is hidden.
Select a Source (apartment complex) to see all materials collected from that location.
Optionally narrow down to a specific unit within the complex.
Optionally filter by a specific waste picker or material type.
Set a date range to focus on a specific period.
Review the Summary table showing totals grouped by source and material.
Expand individual rows to see the detailed transactions that make up each summary.
Use this data for compliance reporting, performance analysis, and accountability.
traceability.tips:
Traceability requires that sources and units are configured in the Sources module.
Transaction source origin must be filled in during purchase recording for traceability to work.
The summary view is great for quick analysis; the expanded view shows individual transaction details.
Traceability is accessible to Admin and Manager roles.
This module is essential for demonstrating regulatory compliance and material chain of custody.

pricing.title: Daily Pricing
pricing.desc: The Daily Pricing module in the Admin Panel controls purchase and sale prices for all material types. Prices can be set for a full day (All Day) or for specific time windows to support different morning and afternoon rates. When creating transactions or sales, the system automatically fills in the correct price based on the material type, date, and time. The 'Set Daily Prices' feature lets you update all materials at once, pre-populated with the latest available prices. You can also add individual prices. Historical pricing is available by checking 'Show expired prices' and filtering by date.
pricing.howTo:
Navigate to Admin Panel > Pricing.
Click 'Set Daily Prices' to open the bulk pricing form.
The form shows all materials pre-filled with their latest prices.
Edit the Purchase Price/kg and Sale Price/kg for each material as needed.
Set time validity: 'All Day' for a full day, or specify a start and end time.
Click 'Save All Prices' to apply the prices for the selected date.
Alternatively, click 'Add Single Price' to set a price for just one material.
To view past prices, check 'Show expired prices' and use the date filter.
pricing.tips:
Daily prices should be set before recording transactions each day for auto-fill to work.
Click 'Set all to All Day' to quickly set all time windows to full day.
The status bar shows how many materials have prices set for the selected date.
Prices are shown in $/kg format throughout the application.
Historical prices are never deleted - they are preserved for reporting accuracy.

admin.title: Admin Panel
admin.desc: The Admin Panel provides system-wide configuration organized into tabs: Materials (manage material types and measurement units), Locations (manage recycling station addresses), Pricing (daily purchase and sale prices), Email Settings (SMTP configuration for sending reports and confirmations), Display Settings (date and time format preferences), Logs (view application log files), Scheduling (automated report email schedules), Confirmations (automatic email notifications for transactions, sales, and deliveries), and Prefixes (customize transaction and sale number prefixes). The Admin Panel is only accessible to Admin and Manager roles.
admin.howTo:
Navigate to Admin Panel in the sidebar menu.
Use the tabs at the top to switch between configuration sections.
Materials: Add, edit, or delete material types. Set the name, description, and unit of measurement.
Locations: Add, edit, or delete recycling station locations with name, address, and manager.
Email: Configure SMTP settings (host, port, username, password) and test with a test email.
Display: Set date format (DD/MM/YYYY, MM/DD/YYYY, YYYY-MM-DD) and time format (12h or 24h).
Logs: Browse application log files and search for specific entries.
Scheduling: Set up automated report emails on daily, weekly, or monthly schedules.
Confirmations: Enable automatic email confirmations for purchases, sales, and deliveries.
Prefixes: Customize the prefix for transaction numbers (default: TX) and sale numbers (default: SL).
admin.tips:
Email Settings must be configured before you can send reports or use automated confirmations.
Use the 'Send Test' button to verify your SMTP configuration is working.
Display settings affect all users and all exported reports globally.
Log files are useful for troubleshooting issues - search by date or keyword.
Scheduled reports run automatically and are sent to the specified email recipients.
Prefixes help customize the numbering system to match your organization's conventions.

users.title: User Management
users.desc: The User Management section (within Admin Panel) allows administrators to create, edit, and delete user accounts. Each user has a first name, last name, email (used for login), password, and role. Four roles are available: Admin (full access to all features including user management), Manager (access to most features except user management), Operator (day-to-day operations like transactions and sales), and Viewer (read-only access to view data and reports). The users list shows each user's name, email, role, status, and last login date.
users.howTo:
Navigate to Admin Panel and look for User Management (accessible to Admin users only).
Click 'Add User' to create a new user account.
Fill in the first name, last name, and email address.
Set a password (minimum 6 characters).
Select the appropriate role: Admin, Manager, Operator, or Viewer.
Click Save to create the account.
To edit a user, click the edit icon on their row.
To delete a user, click the delete icon and confirm.
When editing, leave the password field blank to keep the existing password.
users.tips:
Only Admin users can access User Management.
The email address is used as the login username - it must be unique.
Passwords must be at least 6 characters long.
When editing a user, leave the password blank to keep their current password.
Consider role assignments carefully: Operators can create transactions but not manage system settings.
Viewers are ideal for stakeholders who need to see reports but should not modify data.

profile.title: Profile & Account
profile.desc: Every user can view and manage their own profile information and change their password. The profile modal shows your name, email, role, last login date, and member since date. You can edit your first name, last name, and email from the profile screen. The Change Password feature requires your current password and a new password (minimum 6 characters). These features are accessible from the user menu in the top-right corner of the screen.
profile.howTo:
Click on your name in the top-right corner of the header to open the user menu.
Click 'View Profile' to see your account details.
Click the 'Edit' button to modify your name or email.
Make your changes and click 'Save' to update.
To change your password, open the user menu and click 'Change Password'.
Enter your current password and your new password twice.
Click Save to update your password.
profile.tips:
Your role is displayed in the profile but can only be changed by an Admin.
The last login date helps you verify your account security.
Password changes take effect immediately - use your new password on next login.
All users can edit their own profile regardless of role.

offlineMode.title: Offline Mode
offlineMode.desc: CIVICycle is a Progressive Web App (PWA) that works even when you lose internet connectivity. When offline, you can continue creating purchase transactions - they are saved locally in your browser's storage (IndexedDB). When your connection is restored, the system automatically synchronizes all pending transactions with the server. The connection status indicator in the header shows whether you are Online (green) or Offline (red). You can also trigger a manual sync using the sync button in the header.
offlineMode.howTo:
Check the connection indicator in the header: green wifi icon means online, red means offline.
While offline, create transactions normally - they will be saved to local storage.
When you reconnect, the system will automatically sync pending transactions.
If auto-sync does not trigger, click the sync button (circular arrows icon) in the header.
A success notification confirms when sync is complete.
offlineMode.tips:
Offline mode works best in Chrome and Edge browsers with PWA support.
You can install CIVICycle as a standalone app from your browser for the best offline experience.
Only purchase transactions are available offline - sales, reports, and admin features require connectivity.
Local data persists even if you close the browser, as long as you do not clear site data.
The sync button shows a spinning animation while synchronization is in progress.

languageSettings.title: Language & Display Settings
languageSettings.desc: CIVICycle supports English and Spanish (Espanol). Switch languages instantly using the language toggle button in the header - it shows a globe icon with the current language code (EN or ES). All interface text, labels, messages, and the user guide update immediately when you switch. Display settings for date format and time format can be configured in Admin Panel > Display Settings. Three date formats are available: DD/MM/YYYY, MM/DD/YYYY, and YYYY-MM-DD. Two time formats are available: 12-hour (AM/PM) and 24-hour. These settings apply globally to all screens and exported reports.
languageSettings.howTo:
To change language: click the globe button (EN/ES) in the header bar.
The interface switches immediately - no page reload required.
To change date/time format: navigate to Admin Panel > Display Settings.
Select your preferred date format from the dropdown.
Select your preferred time format (12-hour or 24-hour).
Settings are saved automatically and apply to all users.
languageSettings.tips:
Language preference is saved in your browser and persists across sessions.
Date and time format settings are global and affect all users and exported reports.
The language toggle is always visible in the header for quick switching.
All report exports (PDF, CSV, Excel) use the configured date and time formats.

security.title: Data Security
security.desc: CIVICycle implements multiple security measures to protect your data. Sensitive information such as government ID numbers is encrypted at rest in the database using AES-256 encryption. User passwords are hashed using bcrypt and are never stored in plain text. The application uses JWT (JSON Web Tokens) for session authentication with automatic token refresh. Role-based access control ensures users can only access features appropriate to their role. The backend service runs with security hardening enabled, including restricted file system access, private temporary directories, and memory limits.
security.howTo:
Security features are automatic and require no user configuration.
Ensure you use a strong password (minimum 6 characters, mix of letters and numbers recommended).
Log out when you are finished using a shared computer.
Admins should regularly review the user list and remove inactive accounts.
Check Admin Panel > Encryption to verify that database encryption is active.
security.tips:
Never share your password with other users - each person should have their own account.
The system automatically logs you out after extended inactivity for security.
Government ID numbers displayed in the interface are decrypted only for authorized users.
All API communications use HTTPS in production for data in transit protection.
Database backups should be stored securely as they contain encrypted sensitive data.
